title: Holding Up the Sky: Aboriginal Women Speak
description: Those were beautiful days. How else could I describe them? Everything was so green, the days were sun-filled, the smell of ti-tree and smoke in the air and family all around. Most of all, to me, my mum and aunties were beautiful young women with waist-long hair, black, wavy and shiny.In this unique collection nine Aboriginal women from around the country recount their lives. These are ordinary women - mothers, grandmothers, workers - with extraordinary life experience what it has been lis. Their stories vary widely, but all touch in some way on what it has been like to grow up as a black woman in white Australia. Hertfelt, funny, courageous, disturbing, poignant, angry - Holding Up the Sky is a testament to its contributors'spirit, strength and fortitude.
author: Magabala Books Staff
